game: Root object containing all data required to describe the game for design, documentation, and implementation purposes.
title: The official name of the game.
gameDescription: A brief summary of the game's concept and experience.
releaseYear: The original year the game was released.
developer: The studio or individual that created the game.
publisher: The company responsible for publishing the game.
platform: The primary hardware platform the game was designed for.
perspective: The camera or viewpoint used during gameplay.

vision.description: High-level design intent describing what experience the game aims to deliver.
vision.designGoals: Key principles guiding all design decisions.
vision.playerFantasy: The emotional role or fantasy the player inhabits.
vision.targetExperience: The intended emotional and gameplay feel.
vision.successMetrics: Measures used to evaluate whether the design goals are met.

targetAudience.description: Information about who the game is designed for.
targetAudience.playerTypes: Categories of players the game targets.

platformConstraints.description: Technical and usability limitations imposed by the target platform.
platformConstraints.sessionLengthMinutes: Expected minimum and maximum play session length.
platformConstraints.performanceTargetFPS: Desired frame rate for optimal gameplay.

setting.description: Narrative context in which the game takes place.
setting.settingDescription: Short explanation of the world state and conflict.

narrative.description: Story elements that provide meaning and context to gameplay.
narrative.playerRole: Who the player is in the narrative.
narrative.conflict: The main opposing force or problem.
narrative.themes: Abstract ideas explored by the game.
narrative.storytellingMethod: How the story is delivered to the player.

lives.description: How many attempts the player has before game over.
lives.extraLifeScoreThreshold: the score threshold for earning an extra life

player.hitPoints: Amount of damage the player can take.
player.movement: How the player moves in the game world.

controls.description: Mapping of player inputs to actions.
controls.shooting: Input method for aiming and firing.

systems.description: High-level breakdown of the gameâ€™s core interactive systems.

combatSystem.description: Rules governing damage, weapons, and combat flow.
combatSystem.designIntentOfCombat: How combat is meant to feel and function.
combatSystem.damageModel: How damage is calculated and applied.

movementSystem.designIntent: How movement is meant to feel and function.
movementSystem.precisionRequirement: Level of accuracy needed for effective movement.
movementSystem.momentum: Whether movement has inertia or is instant.

enemyAI.description: Logic and behaviors controlling enemy actions.
enemyAI.designIntentOfEnemyBehavior: How enemy behavior is meant to challenge the player.
enemyAI.aiStates: Different behavioral modes enemies can be in.

enemies.description: List of enemy types with their behaviors and relative threat levels.
enemies.enemyBehavior: Primary action pattern of the enemy.
enemies.enemyThreatLevel: Relative danger posed to the player.

civilianCharacters.canCiviliansBeKilledByPlayer: Whether the player can harm civilians.

mechanics.coreLoop: Repeated sequence of actions defining gameplay.

enemySpawning.spawnScalingFactors: Parameters that influence spawn rates and types.

difficulty.difficultyPhilosophy: Approach to balancing challenge and player skill.
difficulty.noDifficultySelection: Whether players can choose difficulty levels.

failureState.description: Conditions that end a play session.
failureState.failureResult: What happens when the failure state is reached.

difficultyDesign.description: Philosophy and structure behind difficulty progression.

ui.description: User interface elements and feedback systems.

hudElements.description: List of HUD components with their screen positions.
hudElements.hudElementPosition: Position of the HUD element on the screen.

VisualAndAudioFeedback.description: Visual and audio responses to player actions.

artDirection.description: Visual design rules and aesthetic principles.

musicDesign.tempo: Desired music speed and energy level.
musicDesign.adaptive: Whether music changes based on gameplay.

replayability.primaryDriver: Main reason players replay the game.

gameFlow.description: High-level state machine of the game.
gameFlow.gameFlowStates: Distinct phases of the game experience.

technicalNotes.engineAgnostic: Whether the design depends on a specific engine.

references.inspirations: Games or works influencing the design.
